abstract: Update | 7:20 a.m. JPMorgan Chase reported a $2.1 billion profit in the first quarter, besting forecasts as investors hold out hope that the banking stocks have reached a bottom.
lead_paragraph: Update | 7:20 a.m. JPMorgan Chase reported a $2.1 billion profit in the first quarter, besting forecasts as investors hold out hope that the banking stocks have reached a bottom.

abstract: Markets in the U.S. rose substantially as JPMorgan Chase reported better-than-expected profits and largely dismissed the bankruptcy of a major real estate firm.
snippet: Markets in the U.S. rose substantially as JPMorgan Chase reported better-than-expected profits and largely dismissed the bankruptcy of a major real estate firm.
lead_paragraph: Solid profits at the banking giant JPMorgan Chase gave investors another reason to feel optimistic on Thursday, and they pushed stocks sharply higher, shrugging off another batch of shaky economic data.

headline.main: Strong Ending to an Up-and-Down Day
headline.print_headline: Strong Ending to an Up-and-Down Day

abstract: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, said his bank would not participate in the government’s public-private partnership program to rid the nation’s banks of their most troubled assets. His comments, made during a conference call to discuss JPMorgan’s better-than-expected quarterly earnings, raised questions about whether the Obama administration’s plan to stabilize the banking system can gain enough traction to work.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, said his bank would not participate in the government’s public-private partnership program to rid the nation’s banks of their most troubled assets. His comments, made during a conference call to discuss JPMorgan’s better-than-expected quarterly earnings, raised questions about whether the Obama administration’s plan to stabilize the banking system can gain enough traction to work.

headline.main: Dimon Says ‘No Thanks’ to Public-Private Program
